reviews.review: Best co-op survival game I've ever played. There is something massively satisfying about the way the guns feel and the way heads pop off upon a solid headshot. Tripwire frequently adds new content and holiday events can be expected. It is rare to see a company support a game for this long but Tripwire is rather exceptional.

It resides far from the epitome of multiplayer FPS games but exists firmly in its place as a game which offers a consistent potential for good times and plenty of excitment among friends.

Never too many zombies.

[h1] Information [/h1]

Killing Floor ist ein Horror First Person Shooter, welcher von Tripwire Interactive entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

In Killing Floor wählst du zu Beginn einer Runde einen sogenannten Perk aus. Das ist nichts anderes als der spezielle Fokus auf bestimmte Fähigkeiten. So bekommt der Sprengmeister günstigere Sprengstoffe, der Berserker einen Bonus auf Nahkampfwaffen und der Sanitäter verbesserte Heilungsmöglichkeiten. Man kann nach jeder Welle diesen auch beliebig wechseln.

Um das Ganze etwas schwieriger zu gestalten, kann man die Perks leveln. So beginnt man bei jeder Spezialisierung auf Level 0 und steigt nach erfüllten Auflagen im Level auf, was wiederum die Boni verbessert. Eine Auflage für den Sanitäter ist zum Beispiel, dass er eine bestimmte Zahl Lebenspunkte von Teammitgliedern heilen muss um aufzusteigen.
Nachdem du nun einen Perk ausgewählt hast, beginnt die erste Welle, in der du schon dein erstes Geld sammelst. Ist diese zu Ende, wird dir der Standort des Händlers auf der Karte bekannt gegeben. Dort kannst du  gegen das gerade verdiente Geld neue Waffen, Rüstung und Munition kaufen. Sind alle Wellen überstanden, folgt eine Extra Welle, die mit dem Auftauchen eines "Patriarchen" - also eines Bossmonsters - beginnt und erst zu Ende geht, wenn dieser getötet wurde.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Langzeitmotivation
+ jede Runde anders
+ Solo auch spielbar
+ viele Maps verfügbar
+ 4 Schwierigkeitsgrade 
+ Multiplayer
+ gute Grafik
+ stimmiger Soundtrack
+ gutes Kampfsystem
+ verschiedene Perks
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- andere Spieler spielen nicht immer im Team
- manche Maps zu dunkel und unübersichtlich

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Wer Left 4 Dead mag, wird Killing Floor lieben. Klare Kaufempfehlung.

A freind told me about killing floor about a year a go and I will qoute him
"Take left 4 dead, add 2 more people and let them buy weapons from a trader, also based in England and you have Killing Floor." This quote sucks. Hah! He forgot to mention the frecks with the fireball cannons for arms, or the guy with drills for arms that if you piss him off he charges at you like angry bull on steriods. This game kept me moving, gun aiming and checking under the bed to make sure I didn't get raped by a fleshpound in the dead of night. Oh and remember if you think all the waves are over, you forgot their master. The cloaking guy with the chaingun with rockets mounted on his arm. That guy....

All right another recommendation, This is a really good zombie game and I am proud to say that it is and will be better than L4D and L4D 2 but that's my opinion of course. The unique thing about it is that I like is that you can level up with 8 or 9 classes can't remember >.< and each class increases it's goal. example: Commando uses SMGs so when you level up the damage is increased. (max level is 6 good luck getting to it fast). It also has lots of weapons and zombie types included the regular specimen (zed) and the terrifying flesh pound (avoid at all costs unless you have rocket launcher). It is a great LAN party game too with lots of maps to play on including a farm, lab, factory and lots more. RATING 8.3 / 10

A ver, para los que nisiquiera lo conocen es un fps COOPERATIVO, donde el objetivo es superar las oleadas de especímenes (no son zombies), y despues de todas esas waves derrotar a "El patriarca" que seria como el que la pone :3. En si la comunidad de este juego generalmente es amistosa en comparacion con otros juegos. El unico contrapunto es que con el tiempo se puede volver rutinario. Pero ya hay una buena cantidad de horas de juego aseguradas para ir aprendiendo de cada perk, y de subirlos a su nivel maximo (el cual es 6). Es altamente recomendado jugarlo online para tener una mejor experiencia, ya que en single player el juego es mas corto e incluso a veces mas aburrido al estar en solitario y no tener nadie que te rasque la espalda. En fin, yo recomiendo este juego, ya que despues de un año todavia no me aburrio, y en caso de aburrirme a la semana ya me interesa de nuevo. Siempre conoces gente nueva, con distintos estilos de juego, y buscas tu rol en ese equipo.

EDIT: Si bien ahora salió el 2, no duden en probarlo si lo recibieron con la compra de la Deluxe Edition.

This is one of those rare games that you are suprised it is so cheap!  The game addons are all free (except for character skins, but then they are only a couple bucks)  plenty of perks to choose your fighting style and a broad selection of weapons!  This game started off from a UT2004 mod and evolved into this and its also what gave L4D its ideas, dont believe me? play both and you will see similarities.  6 player+ co-op is perfectly challenging and great fun for the price.  I highly recommend playing this game!

Killing Floor puts you and 5 of your friends against waves of "zeds". It's a fun game that has a progression system similar to the Call of Duty series, and allows you to gain perks for each class as you level up. They've come out with tons of free updates so far, and have released optional character skin DLC packs. If you're looking for a challenge, this game is for you.

Insanely addictive, and sometimes insanely hard. It has the perfect mix of cool action and difficulty that'll keep you coming back for more and more until you are bleeding from the eyes, much like an enemy in the game!

A co-op FPS where teamwork is highly recommended but not forced on you, allowing for more freedom in it's gameplay. Has 7 different perks/classes that you can level up, essentially beefing up yourself as you climb the difficulty ladder.

First starting out as an Unreal 2004 mod year ago, Killing Floor has lived up to its name by giving you a variety of weapons; ranging from machine guns and flamethrowers to shotguns and grenade launchers. There's 7 classes to choose from, each with their own perk system. Support Specialists use shotguns, can carry more items and grenades and Sharpshooters focus on ARs and pistols to name a few. As for the gameplay, you're basically thrown into a gauntlet of mutations hellbent on ripping you apart. More players in the game, the more "specimen" you have to kill making it quite the intense game with 5 friends - more intense than L4D )in my opinion). 8/10

Once started off as a small simple UT3 modification, has turned into one of the greatest and somewhat addicting co-op survival horror out there.  You and five of your  mates will have to shoot, burn, explode, and chop your way through grueling rounds of flesh-eating monsters!  Despite the atrocious voice-acting and the sub-par gameplay, the free updates that are provided by the devs are one of the best to come on Steam.

So buy it now with your dosh!

If you love co-op combat games, but wish there was more factors pressuring your fellow players to work together or die? Then Killing Floor is for you. Surprisingly thematic for still using the Unreal Engine, pick this up. If you're on the ropes about it still, visit www.kf-wiki.com to learn more about the game mechanics and places to get custom maps.

"Ever since I got Killing Floor in 2009 on my older steam accounts, ive always enjoyed playing it and i've always enjoyed the fact that you can level up your perks to get certain specials. There is 6 perks and most servers online have 6 slots. That means if you and your friends want to play some co-op, you can be comprised of a team of different specialists. Whether you want to play solo by yourself or play co-op with your friends or others online, you can get your action packed fps mutant killing right here, in Killing Floor."
